title: The Remnant's Choice
shortSummary: Jeremiah 42 records the plea of the remnant of Judah for guidance after the Babylonian conquest. They seek Jeremiah’s prayer to God to show them the right path, and God’s response through Jeremiah warns them to remain in Judah and obey Him rather than fleeing to Egypt. The chapter highlights the importance of trusting God's word and obeying His commands even in difficult times.
timeline: c. 586 BC - After the fall of Jerusalem to Babylon

keyCharacters.name: Jeremiah
keyCharacters.description: The prophet who intercedes for the people and faithfully delivers God's message regarding their future.

keyCharacters.name: Johanan son of Kareah
keyCharacters.description: A military captain and leader of the remnant who approaches Jeremiah for guidance.

keyCharacters.name: Jezaniah son of Hoshaiah
keyCharacters.description: Another leader among the captains who joins in seeking God's direction through Jeremiah.

definitions.definition: A small surviving group of people who remain faithful or alive after judgment or disaster.
A humble and earnest prayer or request made to God.
A curse or denunciation; something detested or abhorred.
To live temporarily in a place that is not one’s permanent home.

outline.heading: The Remnant’s Request for Guidance
outline.description: The captains and people approach Jeremiah, asking him to pray to God on their behalf to reveal the right path for them to follow after the devastation they have endured.

outline.heading: Jeremiah’s Prayer and God’s Response
outline.description: Jeremiah prays for the people, and God instructs them to remain in Judah where He will bless and protect them, assuring them of His mercy and deliverance from Babylon.

outline.heading: Warning Against Fleeing to Egypt
outline.description: God warns through Jeremiah that if the people choose to go to Egypt seeking safety, they will face sword, famine, and pestilence there, and they will not escape judgment for disobedience.

application: Trust God’s guidance through prayer and Scripture rather than relying on human plans or fear.
Obedience to God’s commands brings blessing and protection, even in difficult circumstances.
Avoid seeking refuge in worldly solutions that contradict God’s will, as they lead to judgment.
Be honest and sincere in your commitments to God, following through on promises made to obey Him.

keyVerses.text: If ye will still abide in this land, then will I build you, and not pull you down, and I will plant you, and not pluck you up: for I repent me of the evil that I have done unto you.
keyVerses.significance: This verse reveals God's mercy and willingness to restore those who remain faithful and obedient.

keyVerses.text: Be not afraid of the king of Babylon, of whom ye are afraid; be not afraid of him, saith the LORD: for I am with you to save you, and to deliver you from his hand.
keyVerses.significance: God reassures His people that His presence is their true protection against their enemies.

keyVerses.text: For ye dissembled in your hearts, when ye sent me unto the LORD your God, saying, Pray for us unto the LORD our God; and according unto all that the LORD our God shall say, so declare unto us, and we will do it.
keyVerses.significance: This verse exposes the people's insincerity and warns against pretending to obey God while planning disobedience.

keyVerses.text: Now therefore know certainly that ye shall die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence, in the place whither ye desire to go and to sojourn.
keyVerses.significance: A solemn warning that disobedience to God’s command leads to inevitable judgment and death.
